oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pulsebeat Radio Show: Donna Meade - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Kim Spangler (host) dictating the Pulsebeat section of the Voice of the Heartland Radio Show. The episode interviews Donna Meade (musician). The episode was set to air for the week of September 12, 1988. The episode is part 2 of 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kim Spangler; Donna Meade
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:01) Kim Spangler introduces the upcoming Donna Meade Pulsebeat show -- (00:49) Spangler reflects on why Meade won Miss Congeniality; additionally, Meade reflects on her first experience on stage -- (01:56) Spangler has Meade reflect on her musical family roots -- (02:53) Spangler and Meade reflect on Meade's family's pride -- (03:54) Love's Last Stand (Donna Meade) -- (07:12) Spangler greets the various hosting stations -- (07:42) Spangler and Meade reflect on how long it took Meade to become successful in music -- (08:47) Lay Around and Love on You (Donna Meade) -- (11:21) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (11:40) Spangler and Meade reflect on working for Boots Randolph -- (12:27) Congratulations (Donna Meade) -- (15:16) Meade reflects on how she wishes to be perceived in her vocals -- (16:03) Slow Fire (Donna Meade) -- (19:28) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (19:43) Spangler asks Meade what song she wished to hear -- (19:56) Drift Away (Dobie Gray) -- (23:36) Unidentified tune [featuring Kim Spangler outro discussion] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Spangler, Kim; Meade, Donna;
